data.title: Favorite breakfast taco place around
data.text: My favorite breakfast taco place around the LC area. Staff is friendly, food is great, but don't forget this place is cash only...if you forget they have an ATM inside....and also don't forget the FREE BEANS!

data.title: Our Favorite Breakfast Place in the Clear Lake Area
data.text: I lived in League City for years and was a regular here.  Quaint little place, cash only... killer cheap fajita tacos... homemade corn and flour tortillas ... friendly people.  Now that we live 60 miles away, we plan our visits down south so we can either make breakfast or lunch here.

data.title: Best Breakfast Burrito around!!
data.text: This place has amazing prices and authentic Mexican food.  Tiny and offbeat but super delicious breakfast burritos any way you design them!  try it and you'll love it.

data.title: Love this place. Great Food.
data.text: Some of my favorite carnitas tacos in Houston. Great salsa and beans too. This place is great. Too bad it's not open for dinner.

data.title: average restaurant
data.text: Food was okay, the service was horrible but we were with a group of 10 but it was on a Saturday night so I was hoping they had more servers.

data.title: We Love this Place
data.text: I live near here, and boy do I wish they were closer to my house. I usually enjoy the breakfast burritos and the salsa bar.

data.title: Awesome food
data.text: Cash only.  Best barbacoa i have ever had.  and they dont have chips....they have a big pot of pinto beans instead for you to enjoy while you are waiting the few minutes to get your food.

data.title: Authentic
data.text: Now I see what my Son in law is looking for at other tortillerias--free charro beans and all the fixings.  Fillings were really good, 3 tacos and an horchata for $7.60!

data.title: Very good little hole in the wall
data.text:
Had breakfast here for the first time after hearing about it from friends. The al pastor tacos were awesome and the barbacoa taco was one of the best I have ever had. The 'help yourself' salsa and bean bar had only fresh and tasty fixin's. 

The only negative thing I would say is that we won't choose to dine in again, at least not in the summer. The tiny window unit A/C doesn't come close to cooling down the dining room and within a few minutes of being inside, we were sweating profusely. No biggie, though, we will just grab our next meal to go!

data.title: Inexpenvie food!
data.text: We love going to La India Bonita and getting their breakfast burritos.  It is a very small place but the people are kind and the food is good.  Cash only!

data.title: Great mexican food, cheap prices and excellent service
data.text: This is a little hole in the wall, teeny tiny place with a few tables and chairs inside.  simple menu but OMG the food is excellent.  The breakfast tacos are cheap and made fast.  Never a long wait for your food.  The complimentary beans are always amazing.  My husband adores their green sauce.  It must be made every day since some days its blazing hot/spicy and other days its mild with just a touch of heat.  The man that runs the register (i think this is the owner) is very nice and helpful.  We love this place for breakfast and lunches.  Its priced right for our family of 5 to eat there often.

data.title: Fast but tasty Tacos
data.text: This is a little corner of the street Taco stand, which is actually a free standing one story building. It is a 'quick' breakfast or lunch taco place that has all your usual breakfast meats, ie: barbecoa, pork, chicken, eggs, bacon,  beans, cheese and salsa. Lunch is basically the same plus sandwiches and suops but with sides of borracho beans, rice, guacamole, pico de gallo, jalapenos, etc. All of which is usually rolled up in a flour or corn tortilla. Prices vary inexpensively from $2 per taco to $5 for the Mexican plates. Parking can be a little difficult, though.

data.title: THE REAL DEAL MEXICAN FOOD
data.text:
I went with my son to explore this tiny, not appealing place, and quite a surprise, the food was GREAT.
Very basic ingredients and preparation but loaded with authentic Mexican flavor.
Be adventurous and try the beef tongue tacos (Barbacoa) and the Tripa Gordita you won't be disappointed

data.title: Great Mexican Food
data.text: Anytime of the day is good to go there. They serve breakfast and lunch. They close at 4:00 p.m. So be sure and get there before then. Everything I have ever eaten there has been really delicious. Friendly family atmosphere. Tacos, Quesadillos, and Burritos are fantastic.

data.title: Authentic mexican
data.text: Can't beet the delicious free beans and garnish bar to make your breakfast or lunch unbelievable. They have the best horchata around

data.title: THE BEST Hole in the wall Mexican food
data.text:
This little restaurant serves THE BEST Authentic Mexican food in League City!!!

With free flowing beans and salsa, refreshing hibiscus tea and THE BEST mexican food ever!!! At super affordable rates. Doesn't look like much from the outside but it serves a lot of mexicans if its any indication (mexicans would know good mexican food).

I will definitely eat here again as soon as I get back to League City!

data.title: Best tacos in League City
data.text:
Far and away the best tacos in the League City/Clear Lake area. The al pastor is to die for.

To note:
-They only accept cash, so come prepared
-The tacos are incredibly cheap, you may spend about 5 dollars top per person
-They have free charro beans (very good)
-You will have to put the dressings on your own taco (cilantro, onions, salsas, peppers, etc)

data.title: Tasty Mexican
data.text: Delicious!!!! Best Mexican place! Try the breakfast...lunch also! Make sure to get the ranchero beans in the back of the dining area

data.title: Their sandwiches are awesome (and cheap).
data.text:
Just one of the best breakfast burrito i've ever had!
Their sandwiches (I always get the "Fajita Torta" with avocado and onions - no lettuce) is awesome.
Free bowl of beans (Again, the best)

data.title: Breakfast Burrito as advertised
data.text:
I read where this place had the best breakfast Tacos and Burritos in Houston so 
League City on a visit we tried the burrito. Full and tasty. If judging this book by it's cover I'd never went in, but glad I did. The local's eat here and wait in long lines to do so. We could not get in for lunch, but I'd recommend you try. Open for breakfast and lunch only.
